title: I'm a Fashion Editor and Can't Get Over These 25 Cool Spring 2025 Finds
description: From slip skirts to the latest sneaker trend.
text: With spring ahead, I’m already thinking about the fashion items I’ll be adding to my wardrobe in the coming months. It has been a particularly cold winter in NYC, so I’m ready to embrace warmer weather and shedding some layers. My coats, leather gloves, and ankle boots have been in heavy rotation, but I’m getting ready to retire them for the season. This has me thinking about some of the biggest trends for spring 2025 I’m planning to test out, as well as the excellent new-season arrival trickling into stores.I’ve been heavily inspired by the romantic pieces from the spring/summer 2025 collections, including lace-trimmed slip skirts and soft shades of pastel including robin egg blue. I’ve also been gravitating towards more elegant and polished pieces such as snakeskin pumps and A-line skirt that I plan to wear more of. Ahead, shop my top picks for spring 2025. ADIDAS ORIGINALS Tokyo Leather-Trimmed Suede Sneakers The next sneakers I want in my closet. I love this shortened trench length. Enza Costa Cashmere Sweater Very into baby blue right now. j.crew Gwen Lace-Trim Slip Skirt A slip skirt so good, I own it in three colors. KHAITE Mia Snake-Effect Leather Pumps Bottega Veneta Ciao Ciao Bag Bottega's lastest bag to know? The Ciao Ciao. Wait until you see the back. Veda Carmen Leather Skirt A beautiful take on A-line skirts. Madewell Simone Kitten-Heel Slingback Pumps Everything about this shape. The sunglasses silhouette I'm after right now. Attersee The Sculpted Zip Jacket KHAITE Danielle High-Rise Slim-Leg Jeans The best denim, hands down. I always look to Dehanche for great belts. CHLOÉ Embroidered Tulle-Trimmed Satin Camisole This color is winning me over right now. FAITHFULL Elsain Corded Lace-Trimmed Cotton-Blend Midi Skirt The lace slip skirt obsession continues. Elodie Lennon Poplin Dress COS Square-Toe Leather Court Shoes Jacquemus Rond Carré Calf Hair Shoulder Bag FAITHFULL Elsain Lace-Trimmed Cotton-Blend Twill Midi Dress To style with slingback heels. ZARA Water Repellent Puffer Jacket Banana Republic Siena Slim Italian Wool Ankle Pant I'm very into camel items right now. Polo Ralph Lauren Calfskin Tall Riding Boots A gorgeous take on riding boots. ALTUZARRA Billie Double-Breasted Belted Wool Trench Coat Style this with the collar up for a funnel-neck effect. ZARA Soft Athletic Sneakers Track and field sneakers are a key buy for 2025. Kristen Nichols is the Associate Director, Special Projects at Who What Wear where she oversees luxury, runway content, and wedding features, and covers fashion within the luxury market, runway reporting, shopping features, trends, and interviews with leading industry experts. Kristen has worked with brands including Prada, Chanel, and Tiffany & Co., and her style has been featured in publications including Vogue.com, Vogue France, WWD, and the CFDA. Kristen began her career at Rodarte, where she worked on styling, photo shoots, and runway shows, and at Allure, where she moved into print and digital editorial. She graduated from the University of Southern California, where she studied art history and business, and currently lives in New York.
html:
With spring ahead, I’m already thinking about the fashion items I’ll be adding to my wardrobe in the coming months. It has been a particularly cold winter in NYC, so I’m ready to embrace warmer weather and shedding some layers. My coats, leather gloves, and ankle boots have been in heavy rotation, but I’m getting ready to retire them for the season. This has me thinking about some of the biggest trends for spring 2025 I’m planning to test out, as well as the excellent new-season arrival trickling into stores.

I’ve been heavily inspired by the romantic pieces from the spring/summer 2025 collections, including lace-trimmed slip skirts and soft shades of pastel including robin egg blue. I’ve also been gravitating towards more elegant and polished pieces such as snakeskin pumps and A-line skirt that I plan to wear more of. Ahead, shop my top picks for spring 2025.

ADIDAS ORIGINALS

Tokyo Leather-Trimmed Suede Sneakers

The next sneakers I want in my closet.

I love this shortened trench length.

Enza Costa

Cashmere Sweater

Very into baby blue right now.

j.crew

Gwen Lace-Trim Slip Skirt

A slip skirt so good, I own it in three colors.

KHAITE

Mia Snake-Effect Leather Pumps

Bottega Veneta

Ciao Ciao Bag

Bottega's lastest bag to know? The Ciao Ciao.

Wait until you see the back.

Veda

Carmen Leather Skirt

A beautiful take on A-line skirts.

Madewell

Simone Kitten-Heel Slingback Pumps

Everything about this shape.

The sunglasses silhouette I'm after right now.

Attersee

The Sculpted Zip Jacket

KHAITE

Danielle High-Rise Slim-Leg Jeans

The best denim, hands down.

I always look to Dehanche for great belts.

CHLOÉ

Embroidered Tulle-Trimmed Satin Camisole

This color is winning me over right now.

FAITHFULL

Elsain Corded Lace-Trimmed Cotton-Blend Midi Skirt

The lace slip skirt obsession continues.

Elodie

Lennon Poplin Dress

COS

Square-Toe Leather Court Shoes

Jacquemus

Rond Carré Calf Hair Shoulder Bag

Elsain Lace-Trimmed Cotton-Blend Twill Midi Dress

To style with slingback heels.

ZARA

Water Repellent Puffer Jacket

Banana Republic

Siena Slim Italian Wool Ankle Pant

I'm very into camel items right now.

Polo Ralph Lauren

Calfskin Tall Riding Boots

A gorgeous take on riding boots.

ALTUZARRA

Billie Double-Breasted Belted Wool Trench Coat

Style this with the collar up for a funnel-neck effect.

ZARA

Soft Athletic Sneakers

Track and field sneakers are a key buy for 2025.

Kristen Nichols is the Associate Director, Special Projects at Who What Wear where she oversees luxury, runway content, and wedding features, and covers fashion within the luxury market, runway reporting, shopping features, trends, and interviews with leading industry experts. Kristen has worked with brands including Prada, Chanel, and Tiffany & Co., and her style has been featured in publications including Vogue.com, Vogue France, WWD, and the CFDA. Kristen began her career at Rodarte, where she worked on styling, photo shoots, and runway shows, and at Allure, where she moved into print and digital editorial. She graduated from the University of Southern California, where she studied art history and business, and currently lives in New York.
